questions.prompt: In BG 2.1, how does Krsna respond when He sees Arjuna overwhelmed?
questions.feedback: Krsna is compassionate, but He begins correcting Arjuna and preparing to guide him.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.2-2.3, what does Krsna criticize Arjuna for?
questions.feedback: Krsna points out a mismatch: Arjuna's words sound wise, but his behavior is weak.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.7, why does Arjuna ask Krsna to guide him?
questions.feedback: Arjuna admits his confusion and accepts Krsna as his guide and teacher.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.11, what mistake does Krsna say Arjuna is making?
questions.feedback: Krsna explains that wise people do not grieve for the temporary body.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.13, what does Krsna teach about the soul and the body?
questions.feedback: Krsna teaches that the body changes, but the soul remains the same person throughout.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.14, what causes happiness and distress in this world?
questions.feedback: Krsna explains that pleasure and pain come from sense contact and do not last.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.15, who is considered fit for liberation?
choices: One steady in pain and joy
questions.feedback: Krsna says a steady person who tolerates pleasure and pain becomes spiritually qualified.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.16-2.17, what is the main difference between body and soul?
choices: Body is pure, soul is not
questions.feedback: Krsna explains that the body is temporary, while the soul is eternal and unchanged.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.20, which statement about the soul is correct?
choices: The soul is born and dies
questions.feedback: Krsna teaches that the soul is never born and never dies.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.22, what does Krsna compare changing bodies to?
questions.feedback: Krsna compares the soul changing bodies to a person changing clothes.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.31, why does Krsna say Arjuna should fight?
choices: It is his duty as ksatriya
questions.feedback: Krsna reminds Arjuna that fighting is his responsibility as a warrior.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.33, what does Krsna warn if Arjuna avoids his duty?
choices: He will lose honor and respect
questions.feedback: Krsna warns that avoiding duty leads to dishonor and unwanted results.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.38, what attitude does Krsna recommend in action?
questions.feedback: Krsna advises acting without attachment, staying steady in success and failure.

questions.prompt: In BG 2.40, what does Krsna say about small effort in bhakti?
choices: It only helps in old age
questions.feedback: Krsna says even small sincere effort on this path protects one from great fear.

questions.prompt: Synthesis: What main lesson is Arjuna beginning to learn in Chapter 2?
questions.feedback: Arjuna begins learning that the soul is eternal and that duty should be done with steadiness.
